body.p: A Kentucky attorney and politician. Educated at Princeton College. Admitted to the bar and practiced law in Russellville, Kentucky. Married twice, first to Susan C. Moss Ewing, and a second time to Nannie L. Williams Ewing. Father of Henry Clay Ewing and Johnie Anna Ewing Brawner. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1842 to 1844 and 1859 to 1861. Served as a member of the Provisional Congress of the Confederate States from 1861 to 1862. Served the Fourth Congressional District as a member of the First and Second Confederate Congress in the House of Representatives from 1862 to 1865.
